questions.text: Which bacterial infection is not common in HIV patients?
In HIV patient hemiparesis, headache, vomiting occurs due to infection of which organism:
Co-receptor for R5 variant of HIV virus:
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • (C) CXCR4 – Incorrect. CXCR4 is the co-receptor used by the X4 variant of HIV, not the R5 variant. The X4 variant typically emerges later in infection when the virus begins to use the CXCR4 receptor to enter cells, often associated with a more advanced stage of HIV infection. While both CCR5 and CXCR4 can serve as co-receptors, they are used by different strains of HIV.
  • • (D) P53 – Incorrect. p53 is a tumor suppressor protein involved in regulating the cell cycle and responding to DNA damage. It is not involved in HIV entry and is not a co-receptor for the virus.
